an7.33:4.1: “Mendicants, tonight, a beautiful god, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me,
an7.33:4.4: ‘Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an7.33:4.6: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for samādhi, for conscience, and for prudence.
an7.33:4.7: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
an7.33:4.8: That is what that god said.
an7.33:4.9: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”
an7.33:5.1: “Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an7.33:5.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an7.33:5.4: and keen respect for the training.
an7.33:6.1: One with both conscience and prudence,
an7.33:6.4: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
